Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

How to reproduce: 
* Deselect "Accept cookies from sites"
* Try to access a website that requires cookies to work
* Now try to figure out what domain that website wants to set a cookie for... sometimes not the domain of the page.

Now compare this to the behaviour for popups blocking:
* Enable popup blocking
* Access a webpage that needs a popup to work
* User will get notified by a small yellow bar that the website is trying to open a popup

Basically without a similar UI, whitelisting cookies is not usable, as it is impossib^^very difficult to guess what domain the website is trying to set a cookie for.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:

* Try to access a website that requires cookies to work
* Now try to figure out what domain that website wants to set a cookie for... sometimes not the domain of the page.
